definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: However, the Federal public holidays are almost all observed by all states.
sentences.chinese: 然而，联邦公休日是所有状态观察的几乎全部。

sentences.english: We are sorry, but our offices are closed today and on the 18th.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉我们的办公室今天和18号公休。

sentences.english: Meet me in the Gryffindor common room, 1:00 this Saturday night.
sentences.chinese: 周六晚一点和我在格兰芬多公休室见。

sentences.english: In Australia, markets were closed for a public holiday.
sentences.chinese: 在澳大利亚，股票市场因公休日休市。

sentences.english: Christmas Day is the public holidays of the Western countries and a lot of other areas too.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节西方国家的公休日和很多其它区域也是。

sentences.english: Today is Deepavali so there's a precious day off.
sentences.chinese: 今天是印度人的新年所以有一天公休。

sentences.english: I had to work on Bank Holiday Monday.
sentences.chinese: 星期一公休，可是我还得上班。

definition: to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
official leave from work (e.g. maternity leave, sick leave or leave to attend to official business)
to compensate for working on a holiday by resting on a workday/to compensate for resting on a workday by working on a holiday
leave of absence for a personal matter
to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order
to change shifts/to work in turns
